Package frechetDistance

Class FrechetDeciderTabular

java.lang.Object
frechetDistance.FrechetDecider
frechetDistance.FrechetDeciderTabular
public class FrechetDeciderTabular
extends FrechetDecider
A decider for the fréchet decision problem using a tabular approach.

The decision problem is the question whether the fréchet distance of two polygons is less or equal a given distance. This implementation of a FrechetDecider uses the typical tabular approach.

For that the free space and reachability for every cell of the free space diagram are calculated.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

      q - the second polygon

      Specified by:

    • freeSpaceDiagram

      private FrechetDeciderTabular.Cell[][] freeSpaceDiagram​(double distance)
      Calculates the free space diagram for a given distance and two polygons.

      The free space diagram contains information about the positions on both polygons that are within reach to each other with respect to the defined distance. The returned FrechetDeciderTabular.Cell[][] marks the interval of points on the left and bottom edge for which the distance is within the defined distance. Since the free space in each cell is a convex shape this information is sufficient. If the entire interval is not "free" the corresponding array will be null.

      Parameters:
      distance - the distance for the free space diagram
      Returns:
      the free space diagram resulting from the given distance

    • reachabilityDiagram

      private FrechetDeciderTabular.Cell[][] reachabilityDiagram​(FrechetDeciderTabular.Cell[][] freeSpace)
      Calculates the reachability diagram for a free space diagram.

      The free space diagram contains information about the positions on both polygons that are in reach of each other. By simply inspecting the free space diagram the reachability can be calculated.

      Parameters:
      freeSpace - the free space diagram of two polygons
      Returns:
      the reachability diagram of given free space diagram
